folder: Houston Street (West & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY
text:
Houston Street, south side, west from West Broadway (formerly South Fifth Avenue). All the buildings shown on the south side of the street are shortly to be razed to facilitate subway construction.
July 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
According to the New York Times of April 4, 1938 the City of New York, Department of Markets will erect a 1-story structure to be used as a Municipal Market on the site of buildings shown on the left and which will extend 1 block, from West Broadway, to Thompson Street; the site to include Nos. 89 to 105 West Houston Street and 160
Thompson Street.

folder: Houston Street (West & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY
text:
88-96 West Houston Street, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of West Broadway (formerly South Fifth Avenue). Nos. 92, 94, 96 used to be two and a half story houses with dormer windows, but have recently been remodelled.
February 20,1932.

P.L. Sperr.

folder: West Broadway & Houston Street (West), Manhattan, NY
text:
479, 477 West Broadway (formerly 77, 79 South Fifth Avenue), adjoining the vacant S.E. corner of Houston Street, seen from the rear. These two frame houses, which are faced with brick, probably date back to the days before Laurens Street was converted into South Fifth Avenue by widening it, at the expense of the west side, and extending it from Amity Street (West 3rd) to Washington Square South. This took place in 1870; but this type of house was being built in this part of town fifty years before then, and even earlier.

June 3, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Houston Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY
text:
West Houston Street, north side, at West Broadway, showing both the N.E. (in Nos. 2 & 3) and N.W. (No. 1) corners. The buildings in the latter view bear No's 88 to 92 (from right to left). The elevated system seen on West Broadway is the Sixth Ave. line. No. 3 of this set is eastward from the corner shown in View No. 2 (N.E.).
May 7, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: West Broadway & Houston Street (West), Manhattan, NY
text:
(A7 West Broadway, north across West Houston Street, showing the iron pillars of the Sixth Avenue "E1' still standing at the curb. To the left and right respectively are buildings at the N.W. and N.E. corners. In the distant background appears the Metropolitan Life Insurance Co. tower. View 2 is limited to show the west side of this thoroughfare several months later. Note the absence of the iron support seen in earlier view. To the left here are four Houston Street structures bearing No's. 88 to 94, beginning with the corner. This building extending 98 feet on West Broadway, carries there, No's 490-94.
View 1: March 19, 1939
View 2: May 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr
(5S
West Broadway, west side, and N.W. corner of West Houston
Street looking northwards.
P. L. Sperr  April 30, 1940

folder: West Broadway & Houston Street (West), Manhattan, NY
text:
West Broadway, south from West Houston Street, showing individual photos of both sides of this thoroughfare during and subsequent to the "El" demolition. The cleared areas in the foreground are part of the swath sliced off of Houston Street for the Municipal Eighth Avenue Subway construction.
View 1: April 5, 1939
View 2: May 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr

folder: West Broadway & Houston Street (West), Manhattan, NY
text:
West Broadway, north from Houston Street. View 1 being slightly earlier shows the still present Sixth Avenue "El" pillars. In the background, at Washington Square appears the distinctive apartment building No. 1 Fifth Avenue. This is obscured by the waste paper truck in the foreground of View 2.

View 1: April 8, 1939
View 2: May 19, 1939

folder: West Broadway & Houston Street (West), Manhattan, NY
text:
West Broadway, west side, south from and across Bleecker Street, showing this thoroughfare subsecuent to the demolition of the old Sixth Avenue "El" and its Bleecker Street station. At the right is a curved iron front structure that bears No's. 142 Bleecker Street and 510-16 West Broadway. This is at the S.W. corner of this intersection.
May 19, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NAcg : O 72
